definitions.definition: To authenticate by means of belief ; to surmise ; to suppose to be true , especially without proof
examples: We assume that, as her parents were dentists, she knows quite a bit about dentistry.

definitions.definition: To take on a position , duty or form
examples: Mr. Jones will assume the position of a lifeguard until a proper replacement is found.

definitions.definition: To adopt a feigned quality or manner ; to claim without right; to arrogate
examples: He assumed an air of indifference.

main_definition: To authenticate by means of belief ; to surmise ; to suppose to be true , especially without proof
secondary_definitions: To take on a position , duty or form
To adopt a feigned quality or manner ; to claim without right; to arrogate
